SENT.plain: Mutations in the nebulin gene are the main cause of autosomal recessive nemaline myopathy, with clinical presentations ranging from mild to severe disease
We have previously reported a nonspecific distal myopathy caused by homozygous missense mutations in the nebulin gene in six Finnish patients from four different families

Here we describe three non-Finnish patients in two unrelated families with distal nemaline myopathy caused by four different compound heterozygous nebulin mutations, only one of which is a missense mutation
One of the mutations has previously been identified in one family with the severe form of nemaline myopathy
We conclude that nemaline myopathy and distal myopathy caused by nebulin mutations form a clinical and histological continuum
Nemaline myopathy should be considered as a differential diagnosis in patients presenting with an early-onset predominantly distal myopathy
